questions.neutral: Did the city spit you out again?

hobby.message: Political literature still keeping you up?
Still folding origami to stay grounded?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: You could say that. City makes a habit of it lately.
I just walk a lot at night, keeps me sane.
Hobby of mine, exploring the odd utility space.
Not so easy now. Council's got their eye everywhere.
Yeah, bars have better exits than tunnels some nights.
I fiddle around in old utility corridors for kicks.
Exploring's harder since the reconciliation mess hit.
Even I noticed extra monitors on the access points.
Guess my hobby needs a raincheck until things calm down.
Yeah, got squeezed out again. City feels tight lately.
I spend time exploring old tunnels—call it a hobby or habit.
Used to be easy, duck in after hours, nobody cared.
Not since those 'returnees' stirred things up.
Last week, every entrance was crawling with watchers.
Whole point was peace and quiet, but now? Just tension.
Wouldn't be me if the city let me keep my routine, right?
I do urban exploration, mostly the utility tunnels under Zelezny Prospekt.
Been at it for years, mapping forgotten lines, collecting weird finds.
It all changed after the reconciliation news and the BCI jump.
Tried sneaking in—network flagged me before I got halfway down.
Makes you miss when the systems actually ignored you.
Heard of others getting the same cold shoulder lately.
Spit me out, chewed me up—same difference these days.
My real hobby's urban exploration, mostly tunnels and old data hubs.
Started back when you could trust your BCI wouldn’t rat you out.
Used to trade tunnel maps for stories, a bit of homebrew, all hush-hush.
But ever since those returnee leaks, every hatch is watched or flagged.
I tripped an alert for 'eccentric presence' last time. New one for me.
Feels like the whole city’s lost its sense of curiosity, just policing itself now.
Not sure how much longer the hobby’s worth the risk, but old habits die hard.
hobby_answer: Never boring for me. Too many variables underground lately.
Just keep moving. Eyes everywhere after those Council leaks.
Place changes every week now, not always for the better.
Used to be quiet down there. Not anymore.
Stories get shorter when you watch your back.
Doesn’t get boring, but it’s different now.
Since the statements leaked, even tunnels feel crowded.
Neighborhood groups patrol spots they never cared about before.
Every entrance’s tagged or monitored lately.
Half my old routes are blocked.
Not the good kind of surprise.
Still plenty of things to find. Just riskier these days.
After those drafts started circulating, everyone’s watching basements and tunnels.
Analog lines are getting sealed, official hands all over.
Saw neighbors I’ve never seen before running checkpoints.
Feels less like exploring, more like trespassing now.
Harder to relax, keep your routine.
City’s changed underfoot since the last few weeks.
Doesn’t get boring, just complicated. Lately, every crawl’s a gamble.
The reconciliation leaks made access tighter everywhere overnight.
Used to walk in, now I scan for flags before touching a latch.
Neighborhood watch types with lists of ‘eccentrics’ are suddenly bold.
Got flagged myself last week. Never happened before.
Analog lines buzz with nervous chatter, even down deep.
Exploring used to clear my head. Now it just raises my BCI.
Feels strange missing the old sense of being invisible.
Urban exploring’s never boring, just different every year.
Started with city schematics years ago—my own roadmap when systems were friendlier.
Now, after Halden’s death and the protests, nothing’s predictable below ground.
I feel old when I see fresh barricades and new faces in old haunts.
The tunnels echo with analog gossip—returnees, protests, system ghosts—more than ever.
Was nearly locked inside Utility D-4 after that blackout. Close call.
Marked as ‘eccentric presence detected’ in the logs. Not subtle anymore.
I remember when you could duck a scanner with a scarf and bad timing.
All these changes, it’s like the city doesn’t want secrets anymore.
